subject: Data
title: The Rise of Social Media Data
description: Learn The Rise of Social Media Data in one minute.

hook.text: Every day, humans post 500 million tweets, 95 million Instagram photos, and 1 billion TikTok views.

buildup.text: Social media turned every user into a data generator â€” likes, shares, locations, relationships.

discovery.text: This behavioral data is more revealing than surveys because people act naturally, not performatively.

twist.text: Companies realized social data was worth billions. The user became the product, not the customer.

climax.text: Social platforms now hold more behavioral data than any government census in history.

punchline.text: We volunteered our data. Nobody forced us.

quiz.question: Why is social media data considered so valuable?
options: It captures natural human behavior at massive scale
